definition: to say/to tell/to announce/to report/to denounce/to file a lawsuit/to sue
acrobatic display (esp. on horseback) (old)/variant of 懈[xie4] and 邂[xie4] (old)
to divide/to break up/to split/to separate/to dissolve/to solve/to melt/to remove/to untie/to loosen/to open/to emancipate/to explain/to understand/to know/a solution/a dissection

sentences.english: He never went to Father Porter for confession again.
sentences.chinese: 他再也沒有向波特神甫作過告解。

sentences.english: This elderly Italian guy goes to his parish priest to confess.
sentences.chinese: 一位年長的意大利男人來向他的神父告解。

sentences.english: Catholics go to confession to be purged of sin.
sentences.chinese: 天主教徒通過告解以獲得赦罪。

sentences.english: The sacrament of penance and the confession of sins are rather late innovations.
sentences.chinese: 悔罪的儀式跟原罪的告解是相當晚期才革新的。

sentences.english: Why is confession able to assume this hermeneutical role?
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼告解能夠扮演解釋的角色？

definition: Holy sacrament/Christian rite (esp. Catholic)/also called 聖禮|圣礼 by Protestants
Holy sacrament/Christian rite (esp. Catholic)/also called 聖禮|圣礼 by Protestants
